Class: Fireadmin

Fireadmin

new Fireadmin(url)

Creates a Fireadmin object

Parameters:
Name Type Description
url String

Url of Firebase to use with Fireadmin
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 8
Example
//Create new Fireadmin Object
var fa = new Fireadmin("https://<your-app>.firebaseio.com");

Methods

accountByEmail(email, onSuccess, onError)

Get user account that is associated to a given email.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
email String

Email of account to retreive.
onSuccess Fireadmin~accountByEmailCb

Function that returns account info once it is loaded. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 558
Example
fa.accountByEmail("test@test.com", function(account){
  console.log('Account loaded:' + account);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error getting account by email:', err);
});

accountByUid(uid, onSuccess, onError)

Get account for a user given their uid.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
uid String

Unique Id for account.
onSuccess function

Function that returns account info once it is loaded. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 537
Example
// Get account for uid: simplelogin:1
fa.accountByUid('simplelogin:1', function(account){
  console.log('Account for user with uid: ' + uid + ' is : ', account);
}, function(err){
   console.error('Error getting account for ' + uid + ' : ', err);
});

authWithOAuthPopup(provider, onSuccess, onError)

Modified version of Firebase's authWithOAuthPopup function that handles presence

Parameters:
Name Type Description
provider String

Login data of new user. Required
onSuccess function

Function that runs when the user is successfully authenticated with presence enabled. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 451
Example
// Signin User with email and password
fb.authWithOAuthPopup("google", function(auth){
 console.log('Login Successful for user:', auth.uid);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error logging in:', err);
});

averageSessionLength(onSuccess, onError)

Get count of objects in a given path or list

Parameters:
Name Type Description
onSuccess function

Function that runs on completion of gathering average session length. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 233
Example
//Get the average session length
fa.averageSessionLength(function(count){
 console.log('The average session length is ~' + count ' mins');
});

createObject(listName, objectData, onSuccess, onError)

Creates an object provided the name of the list the object will go into and the object itself. The object is created with a createdAt parameter that is a server timestamp from Firebase. If a user is currently signed in, the object will contain the author's $uid under the author parameter.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listName String

The name of the list the object will be put into. Required
objectData Object

Data you wish to be contained within new object. Required
onSuccess function

Function that runs when your object has been created successfully and returns newly created object. Optional
onError function

Function that runs if there is an error creating the object. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 56
Example
//creates new message object in message list
fa.createObject('messages', {title:Example, content:"Cool Message"}, function(newMsg){
 console.log('New Message created successfuly:', newMsg);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error creating new message:', err);
});

emailAuth(loginData, onSuccess, onError)

Modified version of Firebase's authWithPassword that handles presence

Parameters:
Name Type Description
loginData Object

Login data of new user
onSuccess function

Function that runs when the user is successfully authenticated with presence enabled. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 422
Example
// Signin User with email and password
fb.emailAuth({email:test@test.com, password:'testtest'}, function(auth){
 console.log('Login Successful for user:', auth.uid);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error logging in:', err);
});

fbRef(path)

Get a firebase reference for a path in array | string form

Parameters:
Name Type Description
path String | Array

relative path to the root folder in Firebase instance
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 633
Returns:

A Firebase instance

Example
//Array as path
var userRef = fa.fbRef(['users', uid]);

getObjectCount(listPath, onSuccess, onError)

Get count of objects in a given path or list

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listPath String | Array

The name or path of the list of which to count.
onSuccess function

Function that runs on completion of gathering list count. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 137
Example
//String list name
fa.getObjectCount("users", function(count){
 console.log('There are ' + count + ' users');
});
//Array list path
fa.getObjectCount(['messages', messageId, 'comments'], function(commentCount){
 console.log('There are ' + commentCount + ' comments on the message with id: ' + messageId);
});

  console.log('There are ' + count + ' users currently online.');
});

listByCurrentUser(listName, onSuccess, onError)

Gets list of objects created by the currently logged in User.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listName String

The name of the list the objects will be grabbed from. Required
onSuccess function

Function that runs when the list has been retrieved successfully. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 84
Example
// Signin User with email and password
fb.listByCurrentUser("messages", function(messageList){
 console.log('List of messages by currently logged in user:', messageList);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error getting message list:', err);
});

listByUid(listPath, Uid, onSuccess, onError)

Gets list of objects created by the currently logged in User.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listPath String | Array

The name or path of the list the objects will be grabbed from. Required
Uid String

The Uid of the user that created objects. Required
onSuccess function

Function that runs when the list has been retrieved successfully. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 114
Example
// Signin User with email and password
var uid = "simplelogin:1";
fb.listByUid("messages", uid, function(messageList){
 console.log('List of messages by ' + uid + ' : ', messageList);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error getting message list:', err);
});

sessionsBetween(startTime, endTime, onSuccess, onError)

Get the number of sessions between two times

Parameters:
Name Type Description
startTime Number

The time at which to start the between period (in UTC ms). Required
endTime Number

The time at which to start the between period (in UTC ms). Required
onSuccess function

Function that runs on completion of gathering list count. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 192
Example
//String list name
fa.getObjectCount("users", function(count){
 console.log('There are ' + count + ' users');
});

sessionsSince(time, onSuccess, onError)

Get the number of sessions since a specific time

Parameters:
Name Type Description
time String

The UTC time to calculate from.
onSuccess function

Function that runs on completion of gathering list count. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 215
Example
var dt = new Date(); //Create a new Data object
dt.setMonth(dt.getMonth()-1); //Set date back a month
var monthAgo = dt.getTime(); //Convert to UTC time
//Get number of sessions since a month ago
fa.sessionsSince(monthAgo, function(count){
 console.log('There are ' + count + ' sessions in the past month');
});

setupPresence(uid)

Start presence management for a specificed user uid. This function is used within Fireadmin login functions.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
uid String

Unique Id for user that for which presence is being setup.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 586
Example
fa.setupPresence("simplelogin:1");

uploadImage(image, onSuccess, onError)

NOT WORKING Uploads image to Fireadmin and returns url

Parameters:
Name Type Description
image Object

Image file object to upload
onSuccess function

Function that runs when upload request has completed successfully. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 285
Example
// Request to /upload with image object
fa.uploadImage({img:imgObj}, function(res){
 console.log('Image upload completed successfully', res);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error uploading image:', err);
});

userSignup(loginData, onSuccess, onError)

Modified version of Firebase's authWithPassword that handles presence

Parameters:
Name Type Description
loginData Object | String

Login data object or string for 3rd Party Signup (Twitter, Github, Google) Required

Properties
Name Type Description
email Object

Email of new user (Required only for email signup).
onSuccess function

Function that runs when the user is successfully authenticated with presence enabled. Optional
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error. Optional
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 331
Example
// Signin User with email and password
fb.userSignup({email:test@test.com, password:'testtest'}, function(auth){
 console.log('Login Successful for user:', auth.uid);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error logging in:', err);
});

Type Definitions

accountByEmailCb(account)

Success callback for accountByEmail function that returns the account associated with a provided email.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
account Object

Account associated with provided email.

Properties
Name Type Description
email String

Email associated with account.
createdAt String

UTC Time when the account was created.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 571

errorCb(code, message)

This callback is displayed as part of the Requester class.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
code String
message String
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 33
